item.title: Zenbleed
item.description: - A vulnerability named Zenbleed was discovered that affects all Zen 2 class processors, including AMD Ryzen and EPYC processors.

item.title: Attention Is Off By One
item.description: - The attention formula, a crucial equation in modern AI, contains an off-by-one error that is affecting the compressibility and deployability of Transformer models.

item.title: Google's nightmare "Web Integrity API" wants a DRM gatekeeper for the web
item.description: - Google is proposing a new web standard called the "Web Integrity API" that aims to verify the trustworthiness of a user's browser and prevent cheating and unauthorized modifications.

item.title: Twitter has officially changed its logo to 'X'
item.description: - Twitter has officially changed its logo from the iconic bird to an 'X' after Elon Musk announced the change over the weekend.

item.title: Show HN: I spent 2 years building a personal finance simulator
item.description: - ProjectionLab is a personal finance simulator that allows users to build financial plans and analyze different scenarios for their future.

item.title: 40 years ago yesterday Air Canada Flight 143 ran out of fuel mid-flight
item.description: - Air Canada Flight 143, also known as the "Gimli Glider," made headlines in 1983 when it ran out of fuel mid-flight.

item.title: Have attention spans been declining?
item.description: - The author investigates whether individual attention spans have been declining over the past two decades, prompted by the curiosity about the potential harm of the internet on cognitive performance.

item.title: U.S. Senate bill crafted with DEA targets end-to-end encryption
item.description: - A Senate bill called the Cooper Davis Act aims to require social media companies and online services to report drug activity on their platforms to the U.S.

item.title: Inkscape 1.3
item.description: - Inkscape has released version 1.3, which focuses on improving performance and organizing work efficiently.

item.title: Unicode Character "ùïè" (U+1D54F)
item.description: - The post discusses a specific Unicode character called "ùïè" (U+1D54F) and provides details about its name, Unicode version, block, plane, script, category, bidirectional class, combining class, and mirroring properties.
